events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on February 28th involving their car and another SUV at the intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial accident description and keywords mentioned.
Agent Mark Thompson was assigned to handle this auto accident claim and has started coordinating with the customer.
Customer received official acknowledgment that the insurance company has received and is processing their accident claim.
The agent requested copies of the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and a copy of the customer’s driver’s license.
Customer submitted all required documents including police report, photos, and personal identification for claim verification.
Investigation team began examining the details of the collision and assessing liability and extent of damages to the vehicle.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the other vehicle was at fault and damage estimates were completed by the adjuster.
A settlement was proposed to the customer covering all reasonable repairs and replacement costs for the damaged vehicle.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the responsiveness of the claims team throughout the process.
The claim was formally approved, enabling the company to proceed with payment arrangements to the customer.
Payment was issued and sent to the customer’s bank account to cover the approved auto accident repair costs.
The claim file was closed after confirming all procedures were completed and the customer acknowledged resolution.
The fully resolved auto accident claim was archived for record keeping and future reference in case of any follow-up.
